characters.name: King
characters.composition: King centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “I seem to see some meaning in them, after all. “

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King centered, camera slightly low angle

text: —_said I could not swim_—” you can’t swim, can you?” he added, turning to the Knave.

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King positioned on the left, camera slightly low angle

text: The Knave shook his head sadly.

characters.name: Knave
characters.composition: Knave positioned on the right, camera slightly high angle

text: “Do I look like it?” he said.

characters.name: Knave
characters.composition: Knave positioned on the right, camera slightly high angle

text: (Which he certainly did _not_, being made entirely of cardboard.)

characters.name: Knave
characters.composition: Knave positioned centrally, camera straight on

text: The King went on muttering over the verses to himself: “‘_We know it to be true_—’ that’s the jury, of course—‘_I gave her one, they gave him two_—’ why, that must be what he did with the tarts, you know—”

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King positioned on the left, camera slightly low angle

text: “But, it goes on ‘_they all returned from him to you_,’” I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: I positioned on the right, camera slightly high angle

text: “Why, there they are!” said the King triumphantly, pointing to the tarts on the table.

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “Nothing can be clearer than _that_. Then again—‘_before she had this fit_—’ you never had fits, my dear, I think?” he said to the Queen.

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: “Never!” said the Queen furiously, throwing an inkstand at the Lizard as she spoke.

characters.name: Queen
characters.composition: Queen positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

text: (The unfortunate little Bill had left off writing on his slate with one finger, as he found it made no mark; but he now hastily began again, using the ink, that was trickling down his face, as long as it lasted.)

characters.name: Bill
characters.composition: Bill positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: “Then the words don’t _fit_ you,” said the King, looking round the court with a smile.

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: There was a dead silence.

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “It’s a pun!” the King added in an offended tone, and everybody laughed,

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Let the jury consider their verdict,” the King said, for about the twentieth time that day.

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “No, no!” said the Queen.

characters.name: Queen
characters.composition: Queen centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Sentence first—verdict afterwards.”

characters.name: Queen
characters.composition: Queen centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Stuff and nonsense!”

characters.name: King
characters.composition: King centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “The idea of having the sentence first!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Hold your tongue!” said the Queen, turning purple.

characters.name: Queen
characters.composition: Queen positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “I won’t!” I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Off with her head!” the Queen shouted at the top of her voice.

characters.name: Queen
characters.composition: Queen positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: Nobody moved.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera at eye level

text: “Who cares for you?” I said, (I had grown to my full size by this time.)

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera at eye level

text: “You’re nothing but a pack of cards!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera at eye level

text: At this the whole pack rose up into the air, and came flying down upon me:

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I gave a little scream, half of fright and half of anger, and tried to beat them off,

characters.name: Alice
actions: trying to swat at the air
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera at eye level

text: and found myself lying on the bank, with my head in the lap of my sister, who was gently brushing away some dead leaves that had fluttered down from the trees upon my face.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice lying down, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Sister sitting, camera slightly overhead

text: “Wake up, Alice dear!” said my sister;

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Sister sitting, camera slightly overhead

text: “Why, what a long sleep you’ve had!”

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Sister sitting, camera slightly overhead

text: “Oh, I’ve had such a curious dream!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice sitting up, camera at eye level

text: I said, and I told my sister, as well as I could remember them, all these strange Adventures of mine that you have just been reading about;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: and when I had finished, my sister kissed me, and said, “It _was_ a curious dream, dear, certainly: but now run in to your tea; it’s getting late.”

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: So I got up and ran off, thinking while I ran, as well I might, what a wonderful dream it had been.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from behind

text: But my sister sat still just as I left her, leaning her head on her hand, watching the setting sun, and thinking of little Alice and all her wonderful Adventures, till she too began dreaming after a fashion, and this was her dream:—First, she dreamed of little Alice herself, and once again the tiny hands were clasped upon her knee, and the bright eager eyes were looking up into hers—she could hear the very tones of my voice, and see that queer little toss of my head to keep back the wandering hair that _would_ always get into my eyes—and still as she listened, or seemed to listen, the whole place around her became alive with the strange creatures of my little sister’s dream.

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: The long grass rustled at my feet as the White Rabbit hurried by—the frightened Mouse splashed his way through the neighbouring pool—I could hear the rattle of the teacups as the March Hare and his friends shared their never-ending meal, and the shrill voice of the Queen ordering off her unfortunate guests to execution—once more the pig-baby was sneezing on the Duchess’s knee, while plates and dishes crashed around it—once more the shriek of the Gryphon, the squeaking of the Lizard’s slate-pencil, and the choking of the suppressed guinea-pigs, filled the air, mixed up with the distant sobs of the miserable Mock Turtle.

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: So I sat on, with closed eyes, and half believed myself in Wonderland, though I knew I had but to open them again, and all would change to dull reality—the grass would be only rustling in the wind, and the pool rippling to the waving of the reeds—the rattling teacups would change to tinkling sheep-bells, and the Queen’s shrill cries to the voice of the shepherd boy—and the sneeze of the baby, the shriek of the Gryphon, and all the other queer noises, would change (I knew) to the confused clamour of the busy farm-yard—while the lowing of the cattle in the distance would take the place of the Mock Turtle’s heavy sobs.

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: Lastly, I pictured to myself how this same little sister of mine would, in the after-time, be herself a grown woman;

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: and how she would keep, through all her riper years, the simple and loving heart of her childhood: and how she would gather about her other little children, and make their eyes bright and eager with many a strange tale, perhaps even with the dream of Wonderland of long ago: and how she would feel with all their simple sorrows, and find a pleasure in all their simple joys, remembering her own child-life, and the happy summer days.

characters.name: Sister
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly angled from the side

text: I was beginning to get very tired of sitting by my sister on the bank, and of having nothing to do.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Once or twice, I had peeped into the book she was reading, but it had no pictures or conversations in it.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "And what is the use of a book," I thought, "without pictures or conversations?"

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: So I was considering in my own mind (as well as I could, for the hot day made me feel very sleepy and stupid), whether the pleasure of making a daisy-chain would be worth the trouble of getting up and picking the daisies, when suddenly a White Rabbit with pink eyes ran close by me.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: There was nothing so very remarkable in that; nor did I think it so very much out of the way to hear the Rabbit say to itself, "Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be late!"

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (When I thought it over afterwards, it occurred to me that I ought to have wondered at this, but at the time it all seemed quite natural);

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: but when the Rabbit actually took a watch out of its waistcoat-pocket, and looked at it, and then hurried on, I started to my feet, for it flashed across my mind that I had never before seen a rabbit with either a waistcoat-pocket, or a watch to take out of it, and burning with curiosity, I ran across the field after it, and fortunately was just in time to see it pop down a large rabbit-hole under the hedge.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: In another moment, down I went after it, never once considering how in the world I was to get out again.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The rabbit-hole went straight on like a tunnel for some way, and then dipped suddenly down, so suddenly that I had not a moment to think about stopping myself before I found myself falling down a very deep well.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: Either the well was very deep, or I fell very slowly, for I had plenty of time as I went down to look about me and to wonder what was going to happen next.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: First, I tried to look down and make out what I was coming to, but it was too dark to see anything;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: then I looked at the sides of the well, and noticed that they were filled with cupboards and book-shelves;

characters.name: I
actions: looking at the sides of the well
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: here and there I saw maps and pictures hung upon pegs.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: I took down a jar from one of the shelves as I passed;

characters.name: I
actions: taking down a jar from the shelf
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: it was labelled 'ORANGE MARMALADE', but to my great disappointment, it was empty: I did not like to drop the jar for fear of killing somebody underneath, so I managed to put it into one of the cupboards as I fell past it.

characters.name: I
actions: holding an empty jar labelled 'ORANGE MARMALADE'
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Well!

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I thought to myself, 'after such a fall as this, I shall think nothing of tumbling down stairs! How brave they’ll all think me at home! Why, I wouldn’t say anything about it, even if I fell off the top of the house!'

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (Which was very likely true.) Down, down, down.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Would the fall never come to an end?

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I wonder how many miles I’ve fallen by this time?

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I must be getting somewhere near the centre of the earth. Let me see: that would be four thousand miles down, I think—

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (for, you see, I had learnt several things of this sort in my lessons in the schoolroom, and though this was not a very good opportunity for showing off my knowledge, as there was no one to listen to me, still it was good practice to say it over) "—yes, that’s about the right distance—but then I wonder what Latitude or Longitude I’ve got to?"

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (I had no idea what Latitude was, or Longitude either, but thought they were nice grand words to say.)

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Presently she began again.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I wonder if I shall fall right _through_ the earth! How funny it’ll seem to come out among the people that walk with their heads downward! The Antipathies, I think—”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (she was rather glad there _was_ no one listening, this time, as it didn’t sound at all the right word) “—but I shall have to ask them what the name of the country is, you know. Please, Ma’am, is this New Zealand or Australia?”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (and she tried to curtsey as she spoke—fancy _curtseying_ as you’re falling through the air! Do you think you could manage it?)

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “And what an ignorant little girl she’ll think me for asking! No, it’ll never do to ask: perhaps I shall see it written up somewhere.”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Down, down, down.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: There was nothing else to do, so I soon began talking again.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Dinah’ll miss me very much to-night, I should think!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (Dinah was the cat.) “I hope they’ll remember her saucer of milk at tea-time. Dinah my dear! I wish you were down here with me!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “There are no mice in the air, I’m afraid, but you might catch a bat, and that’s very like a mouse, you know.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “But do cats eat bats, I wonder?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: And here I began to get rather sleepy, and went on saying to myself, in a dreamy sort of way, “Do cats eat bats? Do cats eat bats?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and sometimes, “Do bats eat cats?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: for, you see, as I couldn’t answer either question, it didn’t much matter which way I put it.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I felt that I was dozing off, and had just begun to dream that I was walking hand in hand with Dinah, and saying to her very earnestly, “Now, Dinah, tell me the truth: did you ever eat a bat?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: when suddenly, thump! thump! down I came upon a heap of sticks and dry leaves, and the fall was over.

characters.name: I
actions: landing on a heap of sticks and dry leaves
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I was not a bit hurt, and I jumped up on to my feet in a moment: I looked up, but it was all dark overhead;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: before me was another long passage, and the White Rabbit was still in sight, hurrying down it.

characters.name: I
actions: following the White Rabbit with eyes
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: There was not a moment to be lost: away I went like the wind, and was just in time to hear it say, as it turned a corner, “Oh my ears and whiskers, how late it’s getting!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: I was close behind it when I turned the corner, but the Rabbit was no longer to be seen: I found myself in a long, low hall, which was lit up by a row of lamps hanging from the roof.

scene_features: row of lamps hanging from the roof

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: There were doors all round the hall, but they were all locked;

scene_features: row of lamps hanging from the roof

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: and when I had been all the way down one side and up the other, trying every door, I walked sadly down the middle, wondering how I was ever to get out again.

scene_features: row of lamps hanging from the roof

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: Suddenly I came upon a little three-legged table, all made of solid glass;

scene_features: row of lamps hanging from the roof
three-legged table made of solid glass

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: there was nothing on it except a tiny golden key, and my first thought was that it might belong to one of the doors of the hall;

scene_features: row of lamps hanging from the roof
three-legged table made of solid glass

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: but, alas!

characters.name: I
actions: standing in front of a locked door
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: either the locks were too large, or the key was too small, but at any rate it would not open any of them.

characters.name: I
actions: trying to insert the key into a lock
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: However, on the second time round, I came upon a low curtain I had not noticed before, and behind it was a little door about fifteen inches high: I tried the little golden key in the lock, and to my great delight it fitted!

characters.name: I
actions: trying the golden key in the lock
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I opened the door and found that it led into a small passage, not much larger than a rat-hole.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I knelt down and looked along the passage into the loveliest garden I ever saw.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: How I longed to get out of that dark hall and wander about among those beds of bright flowers and those cool fountains.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: But I could not even get my head through the doorway.

characters.name: I
actions: trying to fit through the doorway
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "And even if my head would go through,"

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I thought, "it would be of very little use without my shoulders. Oh, how I wish I could shut up like a telescope! I think I could, if I only knew how to begin."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: For, you see, so many out-of-the-way things had happened lately, that I had begun to think that very few things indeed were really impossible.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: There seemed to be no use in waiting by the little door, so I went back to the table, half hoping I might find another key on it, or at any rate a book of rules for shutting people up like telescopes.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

text: This time I found a little bottle on it.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "Which certainly was not here before," I said to myself.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: Round the neck of the bottle was a paper label, with the words "DRINK ME," beautifully printed on it in large letters.

characters.name: I
actions: examining the label on the bottle
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: It was all very well to say 'Drink me,' but the wise little Alice was not going to do that in a hurry.

scene_features: table with various bottles and cakes

characters.name: Alice
actions: looking at a small bottle labeled 'Drink me'
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: No, I’ll look first, I said, and see whether it’s marked ‘poison’ or not;

scene_features: table with various bottles and cakes

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: for I had read several nice little histories about children who had got burnt, and eaten up by wild beasts and other unpleasant things, all because they would not remember the simple rules their friends had taught them: such as, that a red-hot poker will burn you if you hold it too long;

scene_features: table with various bottles and cakes

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and that if you cut your finger very deeply with a knife, it usually bleeds;

scene_features: table with various bottles and cakes

characters.name: Alice
actions: holding her finger as if it were cut
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and I had never forgotten that, if you drink much from a bottle marked 'poison,' it is almost certain to disagree with you, sooner or later.

scene_features: table with various bottles and cakes

characters.name: Alice
actions: looking at the bottle with caution
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: However, this bottle was not marked 'poison,' so I ventured to taste it, and finding it very nice, (it had, in fact, a sort of mixed flavour of cherry-tart, custard, pine-apple, roast turkey, toffee, and hot buttered toast,) I very soon finished it off.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "What a curious feeling!" I said; "I must be shutting up like a telescope."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: And so it was indeed: I was now only ten inches high, and my face brightened up at the thought that I was now the right size for going through the little door into that lovely garden.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: First, however, I waited for a few minutes to see if I was going to shrink any further. I felt a little nervous about this;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: I said to myself, 'for it might end, in my going out altogether, like a candle.'

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: I wonder what I should be like then?

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: And I tried to fancy what the flame of a candle is like after the candle is blown out, for I could not remember ever having seen such a thing.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: After a while, finding that nothing more happened, I decided on going into the garden at once.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: But, alas for poor Alice!

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: When I got to the door, I found I had forgotten the little golden key.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: When I went back to the table for it, I found I could not possibly reach.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “What a curious feeling!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: “I must be shutting up like a telescope.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: And so it was indeed: I was now only ten inches high, and my face brightened up at the thought that I was now the right size for going through the little door into that lovely garden.

characters.name: I
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking down then at the viewer
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: First, however, I waited for a few minutes to see if I was going to shrink any further.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: I felt a little nervous about this;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “for it might end,” I said to myself, “in my going out altogether, like a candle. I wonder what I should be like then?”

characters.name: I
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking down then at the viewer
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: And I tried to fancy what the flame of a candle is like after the candle is blown out, for I could not remember ever having seen such a thing.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: After a while, finding that nothing more happened, I decided on going into the garden at once.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: But, alas for poor Alice!

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: When I got to the door, I found I had forgotten the little golden key.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: When I went back to the table for it, I found I could not possibly reach it: she could see it quite plainly through the glass, and she tried her best to climb up one of the legs of the table, but it was too slippery;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: and when she had tired herself out with trying, the poor little thing sat down and cried.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: “Come, there’s no use in crying like that!” said Alice to herself, rather sharply;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: “I advise you to leave off this minute!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it), and sometimes she scolded herself so severely as to bring tears into her eyes;

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: and once she remembered trying to box her own ears for having cheated herself in a game of croquet she was playing against herself, for this curious child was very fond of pretending to be two people.

characters.name: Alice
actions: pretending to box her own ears
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking at her reflection in a mirror
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “But it’s no use now,” thought poor Alice, “to pretend to be two people! Why, there’s hardly enough of me left to make _one_ respectable person!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: Soon her eye fell on a little glass box that was lying under the table: she opened it, and found in it a very small cake, on which the words “EAT ME” were beautifully marked in currants.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Well, I’ll eat it,”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “and if it makes me grow larger, I can reach the key; and if it makes me grow smaller, I can creep under the door; so either way I’ll get into the garden, and I don’t care which happens!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: She ate a little bit, and said anxiously to herself, “Which way? Which way?”, holding her hand on the top of her head to feel which way it was growing, and she was quite surprised to find that she remained the same size: to be sure, this generally happens when one eats cake, but Alice had got so much into the way of expecting nothing but out-of-the-way things to happen, that it seemed quite dull and stupid for life to go on in the common way.
