text: “What _is_ a Caucus-race?” I said; not that I wanted much to know, but the Dodo had paused as if it thought that _somebody_ ought to speak, and no one else seemed inclined to say anything.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Why,” said the Dodo, “the best way to explain it is to do it.”

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: (And, as you might like to try the thing yourself, some winter day, I will tell you how the Dodo managed it.)

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: First, it marked out a race-course, in a sort of circle, (“

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: the exact shape doesn’t matter,” it said,

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and then all the party were placed along the course, here and there.

characters.name: Party Members
actions: standing in various positions along a path
characters.composition: Multiple characters scattered, camera wide angle

text: There was no “One, two, three, and away,” but they began running when they liked, and left off when they liked,

characters.name: Party Members
characters.composition: Multiple characters running, camera mid-shot

text: so that it was not easy to know when the race was over.

characters.name: Party Members
characters.composition: Multiple characters pausing, camera wide angle

text: However, when they had been running half an hour or so, and were quite dry again, the Dodo suddenly called out “The race is over!”

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and they all crowded round it, panting, and asking, “But who has won?”

characters.name: Party Members
characters.composition: Multiple characters gathered around Dodo, camera mid-shot

text: This question the Dodo could not answer without a great deal of thought, and it sat for a long time with one finger pressed upon its forehead (the position in which you usually see Shakespeare, in the pictures of him),

characters.name: Dodo
actions: pressing one finger on its forehead
characters.composition: Dodo sitting, camera slightly overhead

text: while the rest waited in silence. At last the Dodo said, “_Everybody_ has won, and all must have prizes.”

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: But who is to give the prizes?

characters.name: chorus of voices
characters.composition: Characters positioned around the frame, camera slightly overhead

text: “Why, _she_, of course,” said the Dodo, pointing to me with one finger;

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and the whole party at once crowded round me, calling out in a confused way, “Prizes! Prizes!”

characters.name: party members
characters.composition: Characters positioned around the frame, camera slightly overhead

text: I had no idea what to do, and in despair, I put my hand in my pocket, and pulled out a box of comfits, (luckily the salt water had not got into it), and handed them round as prizes. There was exactly one a-piece, all round.

characters.name: I
actions: pulling out a box of comfits
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “But she must have a prize herself, you know,” said the Mouse.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Of course,” the Dodo replied very gravely.

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Dodo centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “What else have you got in your pocket?” he went on, turning to me.

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera frontal

text: “Only a thimble,” I said sadly.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: “Hand it over here,” said the Dodo.

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera frontal

text: Then they all crowded round me once more, while the Dodo solemnly presented the thimble, saying “We beg your acceptance of this elegant thimble;”

characters.name: Dodo
actions: holding out a thimble towards the viewer
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: and, when it had finished this short speech, they all cheered.

characters.name: Dodo
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: I thought the whole thing very absurd, but they all looked so grave that I did not dare to laugh; and, as I could not think of anything to say, I simply bowed, and took the thimble, looking as solemn as I could.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: The next thing was to eat the comfits: this caused some noise and confusion, as the large birds complained that they could not taste theirs, and the small ones choked and had to be patted on the back.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: However, it was over at last, and they sat down again in a ring, and begged the Mouse to tell them something more.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: “You promised to tell me your history, you know,” I said to the Mouse.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: “and why it is you hate—C and D,” I added in a whisper, half afraid that it would be offended again.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: “Mine is a long and a sad tale!” said the Mouse, turning to me and sighing.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse positioned on the left side, camera at eye level

text: “It _is_ a long tail, certainly,” I said, looking down with wonder at the Mouse’s tail;

characters.name: I
actions: looking down at the Mouse’s tail
characters.composition: Main character positioned on the right side, camera slightly overhead

text: “but why do you call it sad?” And I kept on puzzling about it while the Mouse was speaking, so that my idea of the tale was something like this:—

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “Fury said to a mouse, That he met in the house, ‘Let us both go to law: _I_ will prosecute _you_.—Come, I’ll take no---“You are not attending!” said the Mouse to Alice severely.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse positioned on the left side, camera at eye level

text: “What are you thinking of?”

characters.name: I
actions: standing and looking at the viewer
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the camera
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “I beg your pardon,” I said very humbly.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “You had got to the fifth bend, I think?”

characters.name: I
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the camera
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “I had _not!_” cried the Mouse, sharply and very angrily.

characters.name: Mouse
actions: standing and pointing at the viewer
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the camera
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “A knot!” I said, always ready to make myself useful, and looking anxiously about me.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “Oh, do let me help to undo it!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “I shall do nothing of the sort,” said the Mouse, getting up and walking away.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse positioned on the left, camera at eye level

text: “You insult me by talking such nonsense!”

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse positioned centrally, camera at eye level

text: “I didn’t mean it!” I pleaded.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “But you’re so easily offended, you know!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: The Mouse only growled in reply.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse positioned centrally, camera at eye level

text: “Please come back and finish your story!” I called after it;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and the others all joined in chorus, “Yes, please do!”

characters.name: Others
characters.composition: Group of characters centered, camera slightly overhead

text: but the Mouse only shook its head impatiently, and walked a little quicker.

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Mouse centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “What a pity it wouldn’t stay!” sighed the Lory, as soon as it was quite out of sight.

characters.name: Lory
actions: looking in the direction the Mouse left
characters.composition: Lory centered, camera slightly overhead

text: An old Crab took the opportunity of saying to her daughter, “Ah, my dear! Let this be a lesson to you never to lose _your_ temper!”

characters.name: Old Crab
characters.composition: Old Crab centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Hold your tongue, Ma!”

characters.name: Daughter Crab
characters.composition: Daughter Crab centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “You’re enough to try the patience of an oyster!”

characters.name: Young Crab
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “I wish I had our Dinah here, I know I do!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “She’d soon fetch it back!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “And who is Dinah, if I might venture to ask the question?”

characters.name: Lory
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I replied eagerly, for I was always ready to talk about my pet.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “Dinah’s our cat. And she’s such a capital one for catching mice you can’t think! And oh, I wish you could see her after the birds! Why, she’ll eat a little bird as soon as look at it!”

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Narrator centered, camera slightly overhead

text: This speech caused a remarkable sensation among the party.

characters.name: Birds
characters.composition: Birds positioned around the narrator, camera at eye level

text: Some of the birds hurried off at once.

characters.name: Birds
characters.composition: Birds flying off, camera at eye level

text: One old Magpie began wrapping itself up very carefully, remarking, “I really must be getting home; the night-air doesn’t suit my throat!”

characters.name: Magpie
characters.composition: Magpie centered, camera at eye level

text: A Canary called out in a trembling voice to its children, “Come away, my dears! It’s high time you were all in bed!”

characters.name: Canary
characters.composition: Canary centered, camera at eye level

text: On various pretexts, they all moved off, and I was soon left alone.

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Narrator centered, camera at eye level

text: “I wish I hadn’t mentioned Dinah!” I said to myself in a melancholy tone.

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Narrator centered, camera at eye level

text: “Nobody seems to like her, down here, and I’m sure she’s the best cat in the world! Oh, my dear Dinah! I wonder if I shall ever see you any more!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: And here, poor me, I began to cry again, for I felt very lonely and low-spirited.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: In a little while, however, I again heard a little pattering of footsteps in the distance, and I looked up eagerly, half hoping that the Mouse had changed his mind, and was coming back to finish his story.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: It was the White Rabbit, trotting slowly back again, and looking anxiously about as it went, as if it had lost something.

characters.name: White Rabbit
characters.composition: White Rabbit positioned centrally, camera slightly behind

text: I heard it muttering to itself, “The Duchess! The Duchess! Oh my dear paws! Oh my fur and whiskers! She’ll get me executed, as sure as ferrets are ferrets! Where _can_ I have dropped them, I wonder?”

characters.name: White Rabbit
characters.composition: White Rabbit positioned centrally, camera slightly behind

text: I guessed in a moment that it was looking for the fan and the pair of white kid gloves.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I very good-naturedly began hunting about for them, but they were nowhere to be seen—everything seemed to have changed since my swim in the pool, and the great hall, with the glass table and the little door, had vanished completely.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: Very soon the Rabbit noticed me, as I went hunting about, and called out to me in an angry tone, “Why, Mary Ann, what _are_ you doing out here? Run home this moment, and fetch me a pair of gloves and a fan! Quick, now!”

characters.name: White Rabbit
characters.composition: White Rabbit positioned centrally, camera slightly behind

text: I was so much frightened that I ran off at once in the direction it pointed to, without trying to explain the mistake it had made.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind and to the side

text: “He took me for his housemaid,” I said to myself as I ran.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind and to the side

text: “How surprised he’ll be when he finds out who I am! But I’d better take him his fan and gloves—that is, if I can find them.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind and to the side

text: As I said this, I came upon a neat little house, on the door of which was a bright brass plate with the name “W. RABBIT,” engraved upon it.

characters.name: I
actions: stopping in front of the house
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind and to the side

text: I went in without knocking, and hurried upstairs, in great fear lest I should meet the real Mary Ann, and be turned out of the house before I had found the fan and gloves.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind and to the side

text: “How queer it seems,”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind and to the side

text: I said to myself, “to be going messages for a rabbit! I suppose Dinah’ll be sending me on messages next!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: And I began fancying the sort of thing that would happen: “‘Miss Alice! Come here directly, and get ready for your walk!’ ‘Coming in a minute, nurse! But I’ve got to see that the mouse doesn’t get out.’ Only I don’t think,”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I went on, “that they’d let Dinah stop in the house if it began ordering people about like that!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: By this time I had found my way into a tidy little room with a table in the window, and on it (as I had hoped) a fan and two or three pairs of tiny white kid gloves.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I took up the fan and a pair of the gloves, and was just going to leave the room, when my eye fell upon a little bottle that stood near the looking-glass.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: There was no label this time with the words “DRINK ME,” but nevertheless I uncorked it and put it to my lips.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I know _something_ interesting is sure to happen,”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I said to myself, “whenever I eat or drink anything; so I’ll just see what this bottle does. I do hope it’ll make me grow large again, for really I’m quite tired of being such a tiny little thing!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: It did so indeed, and much sooner than I had expected: before I had drunk half the bottle, I found my head pressing against the ceiling, and had to stoop to save my neck from being broken.

characters.name: I
actions: stooping to avoid hitting the ceiling
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I hastily put down the bottle, saying to myself “That’s quite enough—I hope I shan’t grow any more—As it is, I can’t get out at the door—I do wish I hadn’t.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Alas! it was too late to wish that! I went on growing, and growing, and very soon had to kneel down on the floor: in another minute there was not even room for this, and I tried the effect of lying down with one elbow against the door, and the other arm curled round my head.

characters.name: I
actions: lying down with one elbow against the door
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Still I went on growing, and, as a last resource, I put one arm out of the window, and one foot up the chimney, and said to myself “Now I can do no more, whatever happens. What _will_ become of me?”

characters.name: I
actions: putting one arm out of the window
putting one foot up the chimney
characters.composition: Main character positioned diagonally, camera slightly low angle

text: Luckily for Alice, the little magic bottle had now had its full effect, and I grew no larger: still it was very uncomfortable, and, as there seemed to be no sort of chance of my ever getting out of the room again, no wonder I felt unhappy.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “It was much pleasanter at home,” I thought, “when one wasn’t always growing larger and smaller, and being ordered about by mice and rabbits. I almost wish I hadn’t gone down that rabbit-hole—and yet—and yet—it’s rather curious, you know, this sort of life! I do wonder what _can_ have happened to me!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “When I used to read fairy-tales, I fancied that kind of thing never happened, and now here I am in the middle of one! There ought to be a book written about me, that there ought! And when I grow up, I’ll write one—but I’m grown up now,” I added in a sorrowful tone;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “at least there’s no room to grow up any more _here_.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “But then,” I thought, “shall I _never_ get any older than I am now? That’ll be a comfort, one way—never to be an old woman—but then—always to have lessons to learn! Oh, I shouldn’t like _that!_”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Oh, you foolish Alice!” I answered myself.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “How can you learn lessons in here? Why, there’s hardly room for _you_, and no room at all for any lesson-books!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: And so I went on, taking first one side and then the other, and making quite a conversation of it altogether;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: but after a few minutes I heard a voice outside, and stopped to listen.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “Mary Ann! Mary Ann!” said the voice.

characters.name: Voice
characters.composition: Voice off-screen, camera focused on the villa door

text: “Fetch me my gloves this moment!”

characters.name: Voice
characters.composition: Voice off-screen, camera focused on the villa door

text: Then came a little pattering of feet on the stairs.

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned on stairs, camera slightly low angle

text: I knew it was the Rabbit coming to look for me, and I trembled till I shook the house, quite forgetting that I was now about a thousand times as large as the Rabbit, and had no reason to be afraid of it.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Presently the Rabbit came up to the door, and tried to open it;

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned near the door, camera slightly low angle

text: but, as the door opened inwards, and my elbow was pressed hard against it, that attempt proved a failure.

characters.name: I
actions: elbow pressed hard against the door
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I heard it say to itself “Then I’ll go round and get in at the window.”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned near the door, camera slightly low angle

text: “_That_ you won’t!” I thought, and, after waiting till I fancied I heard the Rabbit just under the window, I suddenly spread out my hand, and made a snatch in the air.

characters.name: I
actions: making a snatch in the air
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I did not get hold of anything, but I heard a little shriek and a fall, and a crash of broken glass, from which I concluded that it was just possible it had fallen into a cucumber-frame, or something of the sort.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Next came an angry voice—the Rabbit’s—“Pat! Pat! Where are you?”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Rabbit positioned left, camera slightly overhead

text: And then a voice I had never heard before, “Sure then I’m here! Digging for apples, yer honour!”

characters.name: Pat
characters.composition: Pat positioned right, camera slightly low angle

text: “Digging for apples, indeed!” said the Rabbit angrily.

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Rabbit positioned left, camera slightly overhead

text: “Here! Come and help me out of _this!_” (Sounds of more broken glass.)

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Rabbit positioned center, camera slightly low angle

text: “Now tell me, Pat, what’s that in the window?”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Rabbit positioned left, camera slightly overhead

text: “Sure, it’s an arm, yer honour!” Pat’s voice echoed, pronouncing it “arrum.”

characters.name: Pat
characters.composition: Pat positioned right, camera slightly low angle

text: “An arm, you goose! Who ever saw one that size? Why, it fills the whole window!” the Rabbit retorted angrily.

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: “Sure, it does, yer honour: but it’s an arm for all that.”

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: “Well, it’s got no business there, at any rate: go and take it away!”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: There was a long silence after this, and I could only hear whispers now and then; such as, “Sure, I don’t like it, yer honour, at all, at all!”

characters.name: Mouse
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: “Do as I tell you, you coward!”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: and at last I spread out my hand again, and made another snatch in the air.

characters.name: I
actions: making a snatch in the air
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: This time there were two little shrieks, and more sounds of broken glass.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: “What a number of cucumber-frames there must be!” I thought.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: “I wonder what they’ll do next! As for pulling me out of the window, I only wish they could! I’m sure I don’t want to stay in here any longer!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: She waited for some time without hearing anything more: at last came a rumbling of little cartwheels, and the sound of a good many voices all talking together: she made out the words: “Where’s the other ladder?—Why, I hadn’t to bring but one; Bill’s got the other—Bill! fetch it here, lad!—Here, put ’em up at this corner—No, tie ’em together first—they don’t reach half high enough yet—Oh! they’ll do well enough; don’t be particular—Here, Bill! catch hold of this rope—Will the roof bear?—Mind that loose slate—Oh, it’s coming down! Heads below!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: (a loud crash)—“Now, who did that?—It was Bill, I fancy—Who’s to go down the chimney?—Nay, I shan’t! You do it!—That I won’t, then!—Bill’s to go down—Here, Bill! the master says you’re to go down the chimney!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: “Oh! So Bill’s got to come down the chimney, has he?” I said to myself.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: “Shy, they seem to put everything upon Bill! I wouldn’t be in Bill’s place for a good deal: this fireplace is narrow, to be sure; but I think I can kick a little!”

characters.name: Narrator
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the viewer
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: I drew my foot as far down the chimney as I could, and waited till I heard a little animal (I couldn’t guess of what sort it was) scratching and scrambling about in the chimney close above me: then, saying to myself “This is Bill,”

characters.name: Narrator
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: I gave one sharp kick, and waited to see what would happen next.

characters.name: Narrator
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: The first thing I heard was a general chorus of “There goes Bill!”

characters.name: Narrator
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: then the Rabbit’s voice along—“Catch him, you by the hedge!”

characters.name: Rabbit
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

text: then silence, and then another confusion of voices—“Hold up his head—Brandy now—Don’t choke him—How was it, old fellow? What happened to you? Tell us all about it!”

characters.name: Rabbit
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

text: Last came a little feeble, squeaking voice, (“That’s Bill,” I thought,) “Well, I hardly know—No more, thank ye; I’m better now—but I’m a deal too flustered to tell you—all I know is, something comes at me like a Jack-in-the-box, and up I goes like a sky-rocket!”

characters.name: Bill
temporary_features: holding a small object in hand
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: “So you did, old fellow!” said the others.

characters.name: Others
characters.composition: Characters positioned in a group, camera slightly angled

text: “We must burn the house down!” said the Rabbit’s voice;

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Rabbit positioned centrally, camera slightly angled

text: and I called out as loud as I could, “If you do, I’ll set Dinah at you!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: There was a dead silence instantly, and I thought to myself, “I wonder what they will do next! If they had any sense, they’d take the roof off.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: After a minute or two, they began moving about again, and I heard the Rabbit say, “A barrowful will do, to begin with.”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Rabbit positioned centrally, camera slightly angled

text: “A barrowful of what?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “We must burn the house down!” said the Rabbit’s voice;

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: and I called out as loud as I could, “If you do, I’ll set Dinah at you!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: There was a dead silence instantly, and I thought to myself, “I wonder what they will do next! If they had any sense, they’d take the roof off.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: After a minute or two, they began moving about again, and I heard the Rabbit say, “A barrowful will do, to begin with.”

characters.name: Rabbit
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: “A barrowful of what?” I thought;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: but I had not long to doubt, for the next moment a shower of little pebbles came rattling in at the window, and some of them hit her in the face.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I’ll put a stop to this,” I said to myself, and shouted out, “You’d better not do that again!” which produced another dead silence.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I noticed with some surprise that the pebbles were all turning into little cakes as they lay on the floor, and a bright idea came into my head.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “If I eat one of these cakes,” I thought, “it’s sure to make some change in my size; and as it can’t possibly make me larger, it must make me smaller, I suppose.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: So I swallowed one of the cakes, and was delighted to find that I began shrinking directly.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: As soon as I was small enough to get through the door, I ran out of the house, and found quite a crowd of little animals and birds waiting outside.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: The poor little Lizard, Bill, was in the middle, being held up by two guinea-pigs, who were giving it something out of a bottle.

characters.name: Bill
characters.composition: Character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: They all made a rush at me the moment I appeared; but I ran off as hard as I could, and soon found myself safe in a thick wood.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: “The first thing I’ve got to do,” I said to myself, as I wandered about in the wood, “is to grow to my right size again; and the second thing is to find my way into that lovely garden. I think that will be the best plan.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: It sounded an excellent plan, no doubt, and very neatly and simply arranged; the only difficulty was, that I had not the smallest idea how to set about it;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: while I was peering about anxiously among the trees, a little sharp bark just over my head made me look up in a great hurry.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly angled upwards

text: An enormous puppy was looking down at me with large round eyes, and feebly stretching out one paw, trying to touch me.

characters.name: Puppy
characters.composition: Puppy on the right, camera slightly angled downwards

text: “Poor little thing!” I said, in a coaxing tone, and I tried hard to whistle to it;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly angled upwards

text: but I was terribly frightened all the time at the thought that it might be hungry, in which case it would be very likely to eat me up in spite of all my coaxing.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly angled upwards

text: Hardly knowing what I did, I picked up a little bit of stick, and held it out to the puppy;

characters.name: I
actions: holding it out to the puppy
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly angled upwards

text: whereupon the puppy jumped into the air off all its feet at once, with a yelp of delight, and rushed at the stick, and made believe to worry it;

characters.name: Puppy
characters.composition: Puppy on the right, camera slightly angled downwards

text: then I dodged behind a great thistle, to keep myself from being run over;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly angled upwards

text: and the moment I appeared on the other side, the puppy made another rush at the stick, and tumbled head over heels in its hurry to get hold of it;

characters.name: Puppy
characters.composition: Puppy centered, camera slightly low angle

text: then I, thinking it was very like having a game of play with a cart-horse, and expecting every moment to be trampled under its feet, ran round the thistle again;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the right, camera slightly behind

text: then the puppy began a series of short charges at the stick, running a very little way forwards each time and a long way back, and barking hoarsely all the while, till at last it sat down a good way off, panting, with its tongue hanging out of its mouth, and its great eyes half shut.

characters.name: Puppy
characters.composition: Puppy centered, camera slightly low angle

text: This seemed to me a good opportunity for making my escape;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly behind

text: so I set off at once, and ran till I was quite tired and out of breath, and till the puppy’s bark sounded quite faint in the distance.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly behind

text: “And yet what a dear little puppy it was!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I said, as I leant against a buttercup to rest myself, and fanned myself with one of the leaves.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I should have liked teaching it tricks very much, if—if I’d only been the right size to do it!

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Oh dear!

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I’d nearly forgotten that I’ve got to grow up again!

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Let me see—how _is_ it to be managed?

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I suppose I ought to eat or drink something or other;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: but the great question is, what?

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The great question certainly was, what?

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I looked all around me at the flowers and the blades of grass, but I did not see anything that looked like the right thing to eat or drink under the circumstances.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: There was a large mushroom growing near me, about the same height as myself;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I stretched myself up on tiptoe, and peeped over the edge of the mushroom, and my eyes immediately met those of a large blue caterpillar, that was sitting on the top with its arms folded, quietly smoking a long hookah, and taking not the smallest notice of me or of anything else.

characters.name: Caterpillar
actions: sitting on top of the mushroom
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I stood there, staring into the eyes of the large blue Caterpillar, who was quietly smoking a long hookah.

characters.name: Caterpillar
actions: sitting on top of the mushroom
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: We remained silent for what felt like an eternity.

characters.name: Caterpillar
actions: sitting on top of the mushroom
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Finally, the Caterpillar broke the silence, taking the hookah out of its mouth and addressing me in a languid, sleepy voice.

characters.name: Caterpillar
actions: taking the hookah out of its mouth
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Who are _you?_” the Caterpillar asked.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I felt a bit uneasy.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I—I hardly know, sir, just at present—at least I know who I _was_ when I got up this morning, but I think I must have been changed several times since then.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “What do you mean by that?” the Caterpillar demanded sternly.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Explain yourself!”

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I can’t explain _myself_, I’m afraid, sir,” I replied, “because I’m not myself, you see.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I don’t see,”

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I’m afraid I can’t put it more clearly,” I responded very politely, “for I can’t understand it myself to begin with; and being so many different sizes in a day is very confusing.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “It isn’t,” the Caterpillar said flatly.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: “Well, perhaps you haven’t found it so yet,” I ventured, “but when you have to turn into a chrysalis—you will some day, you know—and then after that into a butterfly, I should think you’ll feel it a little queer, won’t you?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Not a bit,” the Caterpillar said flatly.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar positioned centrally, camera eye-level

text: “Well, perhaps your feelings may be different,” I said, “all I know is, it would feel very queer to _me_.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “You!” the Caterpillar said contemptuously.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Who are _you?_” The conversation seemed to loop back to the beginning, and I felt a little irritated by the Caterpillar’s short remarks.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I drew myself up and said, very gravely, “I think, you ought to tell me who _you_ are, first.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Why?” the Caterpillar asked.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera eye-level

text: Another puzzling question.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I couldn’t think of any good reason, and the Caterpillar seemed to be in a very unpleasant state of mind.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera eye-level

text: I decided to turn away.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Come back!” the Caterpillar called after me.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera eye-level

text: “I’ve something important to say!”

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera eye-level

text: That sounded promising.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I turned and came back.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Keep your temper,” the Caterpillar advised.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Is that all?” I asked, trying to swallow down my anger as well as I could.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “No,” the Caterpillar said.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I decided to wait, as I had nothing else to do, and perhaps it might tell me something worth hearing.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: For some minutes, the Caterpillar puffed away without speaking.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Finally, it unfolded its arms, took the hookah out of its mouth again, and said, “So you think you’re changed, do you?”

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I’m afraid I am, sir,” I said;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I can’t remember things as I used—and I don’t keep the same size for ten minutes together!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Can’t remember _what_ things?” the Caterpillar asked.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Well, I’ve tried to say “How doth the little busy bee,” but it all came different!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I replied in a very melancholy voice.

characters.name: I
actions: speaking in a low, sad tone
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Repeat, “You are old, Father William_,’” the Caterpillar instructed.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I folded my hands and began:—“You are old, Father William,” the young man said,

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “And your hair has become very white;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: And yet you incessantly stand on your head—

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Do you think, at your age, it is right?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: In my youth,” Father William replied to his son, “I feared it might injure the brain;

characters.name: Father William
characters.composition: Father William positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: But, now that I’m perfectly sure I have none, Why, I do it again and again.

characters.name: Father William
characters.composition: Father William positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: You are old,” said the youth, “as I mentioned before,---

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Youth positioned slightly off-center, camera frontal

text: “You are old,” said the youth, “as I mentioned before, And have grown most uncommonly fat;

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: Yet you turned a back-somersault in at the door— Pray, what is the reason of that?”

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: “In my youth,” said the sage, as he shook his grey locks, “I kept all my limbs very supple By the use of this ointment—one shilling the box— Allow me to sell you a couple?”

characters.name: Sage
temporary_features: holding a small box of ointment
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “You are old,” said the youth, “and your jaws are too weak For anything tougher than suet;

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: Yet you finished the goose, with the bones and the beak— Pray, how did you manage to do it?”

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: “In my youth,” said his father, “I took to the law, And argued each case with my wife;

characters.name: Father
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: And the muscular strength, which it gave to my jaw, Has lasted the rest of my life.”

characters.name: Father
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "You are old," said the youth, "one would hardly suppose That your eye was as steady as ever;

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: Yet you balanced an eel on the end of your nose— What made you so awfully clever?"

characters.name: Youth
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

text: "I have answered three questions, and that is enough," Said his father;

characters.name: Father
characters.composition: Character positioned to the right, camera slightly high angle

text: "don’t give yourself airs! Do you think I can listen all day to such stuff? Be off, or I’ll kick you down stairs!"

characters.name: Father
characters.composition: Character positioned to the right, camera slightly high angle

text: "That is not said right," said the Caterpillar.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "Not _quite_ right, I’m afraid,"

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I timidly replied;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly left, camera at eye level

text: “some of the words have got altered.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly left, camera at eye level

text: “It is wrong from beginning to end,” said the Caterpillar decidedly, and there was silence for some minutes.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: The Caterpillar was the first to speak.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: “What size do you want to be?” it asked.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: “Oh, I’m not particular as to size,”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly left, camera at eye level

text: I hastily replied;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera at eye level

text: “only one doesn’t like changing so often, you know.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera at eye level

text: “I _don’t_ know,” said the Caterpillar.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly low angle

text: I said nothing: I had never been so much contradicted in my life before, and I felt that I was losing my temper.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera at eye level

text: “Are you content now?” said the Caterpillar.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Well, I should like to be a _little_ larger, sir, if you wouldn’t mind,”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the left, camera at eye level

text: “three inches is such a wretched height to be.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera eye-level

text: “It is a very good height indeed!” said the Caterpillar angrily, rearing itself upright as it spoke (it was exactly three inches high).

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera eye-level

text: “But I’m not used to it!” I pleaded in a piteous tone.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera eye-level

text: And I thought to myself, “I wish the creatures wouldn’t be so easily offended!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “You’ll get used to it in time,” said the Caterpillar;

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera eye-level

text: and it put the hookah into its mouth and began smoking again.

characters.name: Caterpillar
actions: putting the hookah into its mouth
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: This time I waited patiently until it chose to speak again.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: In a minute or two the Caterpillar took the hookah out of its mouth and yawned once or twice, and shook itself.

characters.name: Caterpillar
actions: taking the hookah out of its mouth
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Then it got down off the mushroom, and crawled away in the grass, merely remarking as it went, “One side will make you grow taller, and the other side will make you grow shorter.”

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar off-center, camera at ground level

text: “One side of _what?_ The other side of _what?_” I thought to myself.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “Of the mushroom,” said the Caterpillar, just as if I had asked it aloud;

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.composition: Caterpillar centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I remained looking thoughtfully at the mushroom for a minute, trying to make out which were the two sides of it;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and as it was perfectly round, I found this a very difficult question.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: However, at last I stretched my arms round it as far as they would go, and broke off a bit of the edge with each hand.

characters.name: I
actions: breaking off bits with each hand
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “And now which is which?” I said to myself, and nibbled a little of the right-hand bit to try the effect: the next moment I felt a violent blow underneath my chin: it had struck my foot!

characters.name: I
actions: nibbling a bit of the mushroom
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I was a good deal frightened by this very sudden change, but I felt that there was no time to be lost, as I was shrinking rapidly;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: so I set to work at once to eat some of the other bit.

characters.name: I
actions: eating the other bit of the mushroom
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: My chin was pressed so closely against my foot, that there was hardly room to open my mouth;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned diagonally, camera slightly low angle

text: but I did it at last, and managed to swallow a morsel of the lefthand bit.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned diagonally, camera slightly low angle

text: *      *      *      *      *      *      *    *      *      *      *      *      **      *      *      *      *      *      *“Come, my head’s free at last!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned diagonally, camera slightly low angle

text: I said in a tone of delight, which changed into alarm in another moment, when I found that my shoulders were nowhere to be found: all I could see, when I looked down, was an immense length of neck, which seemed to rise like a stalk out of a sea of green leaves that lay far below me.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “What _can_ all that green stuff be?” I wondered aloud.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “And where _have_ my shoulders got to? And oh, my poor hands, how is it I can’t see you?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I was moving them about as I spoke, but no result seemed to follow, except a little shaking among the distant green leaves.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: As there seemed to be no chance of getting my hands up to my head, I tried to get my head down to them, and was delighted to find that my neck would bend about easily in any direction, like a serpent.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I had just succeeded in curving it down into a graceful zigzag, and was going to dive in among the leaves, which I found to be nothing but the tops of the trees under which I had been wandering, when a sharp hiss made me draw back in a hurry: a large pigeon had flown into my face, and was beating me violently with its wings.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Serpent!” screamed the Pigeon.

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I’m _not_ a serpent!” I said indignantly.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Let me alone!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Serpent, I say again!”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: repeated the Pigeon, but in a more subdued tone, and added with a kind of sob, “I’ve tried every way, and nothing seems to suit them!”

characters.name: Pigeon
actions: repeating words in a subdued tone
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “I haven’t the least idea what you’re talking about,” I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “but those serpents! There’s no pleasing them!”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly low angle

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “As if it wasn’t trouble enough hatching the eggs,”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly low angle

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon positioned on the left side of the frame, camera at eye level

text: “I’m very sorry you’ve been annoyed,” I said, who was beginning to see its meaning.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned on the right side of the frame, camera at eye level

text: “And just as I’d taken the highest tree in the wood,” continued the Pigeon, raising its voice to a shriek, “and just as I was thinking I should be free of them at last, they must needs come wriggling down from the sky! Ugh, Serpent!”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon positioned on the top left side of the frame, camera slightly below eye level

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned on the right side of the frame, camera at eye level

text: “I’m a—I’m a—”

characters.name: I

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon positioned to the left, camera slightly overhead

text: “I can see you’re trying to invent something!”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon positioned to the left, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon positioned to the left, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead
