characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “but little girls eat eggs quite as much as serpents do, you know.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “I don’t believe it,” the Pigeon said;

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “but if they do, why then they’re a kind of serpent, that’s all I can say.”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: This was such a new idea to me, that I was quite silent for a minute or two, which gave the Pigeon the opportunity of adding, “You’re looking for eggs, I know _that_ well enough; and what does it matter to me whether you’re a little girl or a serpent?”

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “It matters a good deal to _me_,” I said hastily;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “but I’m not looking for eggs, as it happens; and if I was, I shouldn’t want _yours_: I don’t like them raw.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Well, be off, then!” the Pigeon said in a sulky tone, as it settled down again into its nest.

characters.name: Pigeon
characters.composition: Pigeon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I crouched down among the trees as well as I could, for my neck kept getting entangled among the branches, and every now and then I had to stop and untwist it.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: After a while, I remembered that I still held the pieces of mushroom in my hands, and I set to work very carefully, nibbling first at one and then at the other, and growing sometimes taller and sometimes shorter, until I had succeeded in bringing myself down to my usual height.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: It was so long since I had been anything near the right size, that it felt quite strange at first;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Come, there’s half my plan done now! How puzzling all these changes are! I’m never sure what I’m going to be, from one minute to another! However, I’ve got back to my right size: the next thing is, to get into that beautiful garden—how _is_ that to be done, I wonder?”

scene_features: little house about four feet high

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: As I said this, I came suddenly upon an open place, with a little house in it about four feet high.

scene_features: little house about four feet high

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: “Whoever lives there,” I thought, “it’ll never do to come upon them _this_ size: why, I should frighten them out of their wits!”

scene_features: little house about four feet high

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: So I began nibbling at the righthand bit again, and did not venture to go near the house till I had brought myself down to nine inches high.

scene_features: little house about four feet high

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: I stood there, staring at the quaint little house, trying to figure out my next move.

scene_features: little house about four feet high

characters.name: I
actions: staring at the quaint little house
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking at the quaint little house
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: Suddenly, a footman in livery came rushing out of the woods.

scene_features: little house about four feet high

characters.name: Footman
characters.composition: Footman positioned on the left, camera slightly behind

text: His face was so peculiar that I would have called him a fish if not for his attire.

characters.name: Fish-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: He rapped loudly on the door with his knuckles.

characters.name: Fish-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: The door opened to reveal another footman, this one with a round face and large eyes like a frog.

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: Both had powdered hair that curled all over their heads.

characters.name: Fish-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: I crept closer to listen.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: The Fish-Footman produced a large letter from under his arm, nearly as big as himself, and handed it to the Frog-Footman, saying in a solemn tone, “For the Duchess. An invitation from the Queen to play croquet.”

characters.name: Fish-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: The Frog-Footman repeated, “From the Queen. An invitation for the Duchess to play croquet.”

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: They both bowed low, and their curls got entangled together.

characters.name: Fish-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera frontal

text: I laughed so hard that I had to run back into the woods for fear they’d hear me.

characters.name: I
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking over shoulder towards the direction of laughter
characters.composition: Main character in mid-run, camera slightly behind and above

text: When I peeked out again, the Fish-Footman was gone, and the Frog-Footman was sitting on the ground, staring up at the sky.

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Frog-Footman centered, camera slightly low angle

text: I approached the door timidly and knocked.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: The Frog-Footman, still staring up, said, “There’s no sort of use in knocking, and that for two reasons. First, because I’m on the same side of the door as you are; secondly, because they’re making such a noise inside, no one could possibly hear you.”

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Frog-Footman centered, camera slightly low angle

text: Indeed, there was a constant howling and sneezing, punctuated by crashes as if dishes or kettles were being broken.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: “Please, then,” I said, “how am I to get in?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind

text: “There might be some sense in your knocking,”

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Frog-Footman centered, camera slightly low angle

text: He continued without looking at me, “if we had the door between us. For instance, if you were inside, you might knock, and I could let you out, you know.”

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: He was still gazing at the sky, which I found decidedly uncivil.

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: “But perhaps he can’t help it,” I thought to myself.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “His eyes are so very nearly at the top of his head. But at any rate he might answer questions.—How am I to get in?” I repeated aloud.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I shall sit here,” the Frog-Footman remarked, “till tomorrow—”

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: Just then, the door of the house opened, and a large plate came skimming out, straight at his head.

characters.name: I
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking at the plate flying towards him
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: It grazed his nose and shattered against a tree behind him.

characters.name: I
actions: standing still, looking at the shattered plate
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking at the ground where the plate shattered
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “—or next day, maybe,” he continued as if nothing had happened.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “How am I to get in?” I asked again, louder this time.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Are you to get in at all?” he said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “That’s the first question, you know.”

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I muttered to myself, “It’s really dreadful, the way all the creatures argue. It’s enough to drive one crazy!”

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The Frog-Footman seemed to think this a good opportunity for repeating his statement, but I was already considering my next move.

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I shall sit here,” he said, “on and off, for days and days.”

characters.name: Frog-Footman
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “But what am _I_ to do?”

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I asked, feeling a bit lost.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Anything you like,” the Footman replied, and began whistling.

characters.name: Footman
characters.composition: Footman positioned to the right, camera slightly overhead

text: “Oh, there’s no use in talking to him,” I said desperately.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “He’s perfectly idiotic!” And with that, I opened the door and stepped inside.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The door led right into a large kitchen, which was full of smoke from one end to the other.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The Duchess was sitting on a three-legged stool in the middle, nursing a baby.

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly low angle

text: The cook was leaning over the fire, stirring a large cauldron that seemed to be full of soup.

characters.name: Cook
characters.composition: Cook positioned to the right, camera slightly low angle

text: “There’s certainly too much pepper in that soup!” I thought to myself, trying to suppress a sneeze.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The air was thick with pepper, making it hard to breathe.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Even the Duchess sneezed occasionally, and the baby alternated between sneezing and howling without a moment’s pause.

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly low angle

text: The only things in the kitchen that did not sneeze were the cook and a large cat sitting on the hearth, grinning from ear to ear.

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Please would you tell me,”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I said, a little timidly, “why your cat grins like that?”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “It’s a Cheshire cat,” the Duchess replied, “and that’s why. Pig!”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly high angle

text: Her sudden outburst made me jump, but I realized she was addressing the baby, not me.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: Taking courage, I continued, “I didn’t know that Cheshire cats always grinned; in fact, I didn’t know that cats _could_ grin.”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “They all can,” the Duchess said, “and most of ’em do.”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly high angle

text: “I don’t know of any that do,”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “You don’t know much,” the Duchess retorted, “and that’s a fact.”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera at eye level

text: I didn’t like the tone of her remark, so I decided to change the subject.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: While I was trying to think of something else to say, the cook took the cauldron of soup off the fire and began throwing everything within her reach at the Duchess and the baby.

characters.name: Cook
actions: removing a cauldron from the fire
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking at the Duchess and baby
characters.composition: Cook off-center, camera slightly low angle

text: Fire-irons, saucepans, plates, and dishes flew everywhere.

characters.name: Cook
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking at the Duchess and baby
characters.composition: Cook off-center, camera slightly low angle

text: The Duchess barely noticed, and the baby’s howling made it impossible to tell if the blows were hurting it.

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess off-center, camera at eye level

text: “Oh, _please_ mind what you’re doing!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character off-center, camera at eye level

text: I cried, jumping up and down in terror.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Oh, there goes his _precious_ nose!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: as an unusually large saucepan flew close by it, nearly taking it off.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “If everybody minded their own business,”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: the Duchess said in a hoarse growl, “the world would go round a deal faster than it does.”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Which would _not_ be an advantage,”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: I said, glad to show off a little of my knowledge.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Just think of what work it would make with the day and night! You see the earth takes twenty-four hours to turn round on its axis—”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly low angle

text: “Talking of axes,” the Duchess interrupted, “chop off her head!”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: I glanced anxiously at the cook, wondering if she would take the hint.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: But the cook was busy stirring the soup and didn’t seem to be listening.

characters.name: Cook
characters.composition: Cook positioned off-center, camera slightly low angle

text: So I continued, “Twenty-four hours, I _think_; or is it twelve? I—”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera at eye level

text: “Oh, don’t bother _me_,” the Duchess said impatiently.

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess positioned centrally, camera slightly low angle

text: “I never could abide figures!”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Duchess positioned off-center, camera slightly low angle

text: “Talking of axes,” the Duchess interrupted, “chop off her head!”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I glanced anxiously at the cook, wondering if she would take the hint.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: But the cook was busy stirring the soup and didn’t seem to be listening.

characters.name: Cook
characters.composition: Character positioned off-center, camera slightly low angle

text: So I continued, “Twenty-four hours, I _think_; or is it twelve? I—”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera at eye level

text: “Oh, don’t bother _me_,” the Duchess said impatiently.

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “I never could abide figures!”

characters.name: Duchess
characters.composition: Character positioned off-center, camera at eye level

text: And with that she began nursing her child again, singing a sort of lullaby to it as she did so, and giving it a violent shake at the end of every line:

characters.name: Duchess
actions: shaking the baby violently at the end of each line
temporary_features: holding the baby with one hand
characters.composition: Duchess positioned to the left, baby centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Speak roughly to your little boy, And beat him when he sneezes: He only does it to annoy, Because he knows it teases.”

characters.name: Duchess
temporary_features: holding the baby with one hand
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly overhead

text: CHORUS. (In which the cook and the baby joined): “Wow! wow! wow!”

characters.name: Cook
characters.composition: Cook positioned to the right, camera slightly overhead

text: While the Duchess sang the second verse of the song, she kept tossing the baby violently up and down, and the poor little thing howled so, that I could hardly hear the words:

characters.name: Duchess
actions: tossing the baby violently up and down
temporary_features: holding the baby with one hand
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I speak severely to my boy, I beat him when he sneezes; For he can thoroughly enjoy The pepper when he pleases!”

characters.name: Duchess
temporary_features: holding the baby with one hand
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly overhead

text: CHORUS. “Wow! wow! wow!”

characters.name: Cook
characters.composition: Cook positioned to the right, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Duchess
actions: flinging the baby towards the viewer
temporary_features: holding the baby with one hand
characters.composition: Duchess centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I must go and get ready to play croquet with the Queen,” and she hurried out of the room.

characters.name: Alice
actions: hurriedly walking out of the room
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind her

text: The cook threw a frying-pan after her as she went out, but it just missed her.

characters.name: Cook
actions: throwing a frying-pan towards the door
characters.composition: Main character on the left, camera slightly low angle

text: I caught the baby with some difficulty, as it was a queer-shaped little creature, and held out its arms and legs in all directions, “just like a star-fish,” I thought.

characters.name: Alice
temporary_features: holding a baby with outstretched limbs
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The poor little thing was snorting like a steam-engine when I caught it, and kept doubling itself up and straightening itself out again, so that altogether, for the first minute or two, it was as much as I could do to hold it.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: As soon as I had made out the proper way of nursing it, (which was to twist it up into a sort of knot, and then keep tight hold of its right ear and left foot, so as to prevent it from undoing itself,) I carried it out into the open air.

characters.name: Alice
actions: carrying the baby in a twisted knot
temporary_features: holding a baby in a twisted knot
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind her

text: “If I don’t take this child away with me,”

characters.name: Alice
temporary_features: holding a baby in a twisted knot
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly behind her

text: I thought, “they’re sure to kill it in a day or two: wouldn’t it be murder to leave it behind?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, camera slightly angled from the side

text: I said the last words out loud, and the little thing grunted in reply (it had left off sneezing by this time).

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

characters.name: Baby
characters.composition: Baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

text: “Don’t grunt,” I said;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

text: “that’s not at all a proper way of expressing yourself.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

text: The baby grunted again, and I looked very anxiously into its face to see what was the matter with it.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

characters.name: Baby
characters.composition: Baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

text: There could be no doubt that it had a _very_ turn-up nose, much more like a snout than a real nose;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

characters.name: Baby
characters.composition: Baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

text: also its eyes were getting extremely small for a baby: altogether I did not like the look of the thing at all.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character seated, baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

characters.name: Baby
characters.composition: Baby in foreground, camera slightly angled from the side

characters.name: I
actions: looking into the eyes of a small creature
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: No, there were no tears.

characters.name: I
actions: looking into the eyes of a small creature
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “If you’re going to turn into a pig, my dear,” I said, seriously, “I’ll have nothing more to do with you. Mind now!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The poor little thing sobbed again (or grunted, it was impossible to say which), and we went on for some while in silence.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I was just beginning to think to myself, “Now, what am I to do with this creature when I get it home?”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: when it grunted again, so violently, that I looked down into its face in some alarm.

characters.name: I
actions: looking down at the creature in alarm
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: This time there could be _no_ mistake about it: it was neither more nor less than a pig, and I felt that it would be quite absurd for me to carry it further.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: So I set the little creature down, and felt quite relieved to see it trot away quietly into the wood.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “If it had grown up,” I said to myself, “it would have made a dreadfully ugly child: but it makes a rather pretty pig, I think.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: And she began thinking over other children she knew, who might do very well as pigs, and was just saying to herself, “if one only knew the right way to change them—”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: when I was a little startled by seeing the Cheshire Cat sitting on a bough of a tree a few yards off.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The Cat only grinned when it saw me.

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Cheshire Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: It looked good-natured, I thought: still it had very long claws and a great many teeth, so I felt that it ought to be treated with respect.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Cheshire Puss,” I began, rather timidly, as I did not at all know whether it would like the name: however, it only grinned a little wider.

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “Come, it’s pleased so far,” I thought, and I went on.

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “Would you tell me, please, which way I ought to go from here?”

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “That depends a good deal on where you want to get to,” said the Cat.

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “I don’t much care where—”

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “Then it doesn’t matter which way you go,” said the Cat.

characters.name: Cat
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the camera
characters.composition: Cat positioned on the left side, camera at eye level

characters.name: I
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking slightly upward at the Cat
characters.composition: Main character positioned on the right side, camera slightly overhead

text: “Oh, you’re sure to do that,” said the Cat, “if you only walk long enough.”

characters.name: Cat
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the camera
characters.composition: Cat positioned on the left side, camera at eye level

characters.name: I

characters.gaze_and_direction: looking slightly upward at the Cat
characters.composition: Main character positioned on the right side, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Cheshire Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “But I don’t want to go among mad people,” I remarked.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Oh, you can’t help that,” said the Cat: “we’re all mad here. I’m mad. You’re mad.”

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.composition: Cheshire Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “How do you know I’m mad?” I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “You must be,” said the Cat, “or you wouldn’t have come here.”

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat positioned slightly to the side, camera at eye level

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “To begin with,” said the Cat, “a dog’s not mad. You grant that?”

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat positioned slightly to the side, camera at eye level

text: “I suppose so,” I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly above eye level

text: Now I growl when I’m pleased, and wag my tail when I’m angry.

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly above eye level

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly above eye level

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: “Call it what you like,” said the Cat.

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly above eye level

characters.name: Cat
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the viewer
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: I

characters.name: Cat

characters.name: I

text: While I was looking at the place where it had been, it suddenly appeared again.

characters.name: Cat
actions: appearing in a puff of smoke
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “By-the-bye, what became of the baby?”

characters.name: Cat
characters.gaze_and_direction: direct eye contact with the viewer
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I’d nearly forgotten to ask.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “It turned into a pig,” I quietly said, just as if it had come back in a natural way.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I thought it would,” said the Cat, and vanished again.

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I waited a little, half expecting to see it again, but it did not appear, and after a minute or two I walked on in the direction in which the March Hare was said to live.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “I’ve seen hatters before,”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I said to myself;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “the March Hare will be much the most interesting, and perhaps as this is May it won’t be raving mad—at least not so mad as it was in March.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: As I said this, I looked up, and there was the Cat again, sitting on a branch of a tree.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character looking up, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly below

text: “Did you say pig, or fig?” said the Cat.

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly below

text: “I said pig,” I replied;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character looking up, camera slightly overhead

text: “and I wish you wouldn’t keep appearing and vanishing so suddenly: you make one quite giddy.”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character looking up, camera slightly overhead

text: “All right,” said the Cat;

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and this time it vanished quite slowly, beginning with the end of the tail, and ending with the grin, which remained some time after the rest of it had gone.

characters.name: Cat
characters.composition: Cat centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Well! I’ve often seen a cat without a grin,” I thought;

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “but a grin without a cat! It’s the most curious thing I ever saw in my life!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I had not gone much farther before I came in sight of the house of the March Hare.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I thought it must be the right house, because the chimneys were shaped like ears and the roof was thatched with fur.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: It was so large a house, that I did not like to go nearer till I had nibbled some more of the lefthand bit of mushroom, and raised myself to about two feet high.

characters.name: I
actions: raising self to two feet high
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: Even then, I walked up towards it rather timidly, saying to myself, “Suppose it should be raving mad after all! I almost wish I’d gone to see the Hatter instead!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I approached the house and saw a table set out under a tree.

characters.name: I
actions: looking at the table under the tree
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The March Hare and the Hatter were having tea, with a Dormouse fast asleep between them.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Character positioned on the left, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Character positioned on the right, camera slightly overhead

text: The two were using the Dormouse as a cushion, their elbows resting on it as they talked over its head.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Character positioned on the left, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Character positioned on the right, camera slightly overhead

text: “Very uncomfortable for the Dormouse,” I thought, though it didn't seem to mind being asleep.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The table was large, but the three of them were crowded together at one corner.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "No room! No room!" they cried out when they saw me coming.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera at eye level

text: "There’s plenty of room!" I said indignantly, and I sat down in a large arm-chair at one end of the table.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "Have some wine," the March Hare said in an encouraging tone.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Character positioned to the right, camera at eye level

text: I looked all around the table but saw only tea.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "I don’t see any wine,"

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I remarked.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "There isn’t any," the March Hare replied.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "Then it wasn’t very civil of you to offer it," I said angrily.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "It wasn’t very civil of you to sit down without being invited," the March Hare retorted.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "I didn’t know it was your table,"

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "It’s laid for a great many more than three."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "Your hair wants cutting," the Hatter said.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned to the left, camera slightly overhead

text: He had been looking at me with great curiosity, and this was his first speech.

characters.name: Hatter
actions: staring at the viewer with curiosity
characters.composition: Hatter positioned to the left, camera slightly overhead

text: "You should learn not to make personal remarks," I said with some severity.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "It’s very rude."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The Hatter opened his eyes very wide on hearing this but all he said was, "Why is a raven like a writing-desk?"

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

text: "Come, we shall have some fun now!" I thought.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "I’m glad they’ve begun asking riddles.—I believe I can guess that," I added aloud.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: "Do you mean that you think you can find out the answer to it?" the March Hare asked.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: March Hare positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: "Then you should say what you mean," the March Hare continued.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: "At least—at least I mean what I say—that’s the same thing, you know."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

text: "Not the same thing a bit!" the Hatter said.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera at eye level

characters.name: Alice

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: March Hare positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Dormouse positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "It is the same thing with you," said the Hatter, and here the conversation dropped.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: The party sat silent for a minute while I thought over all I could remember about ravens and writing-desks, which wasn’t much.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly overhead

text: I considered a little and then said, "The fourth."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "Two days wrong!" sighed the Hatter.

characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter

characters.name: Hatter

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned to the left, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Character positioned to the right, camera slightly angled

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.composition: Character positioned to the right, camera slightly angled

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.gaze_and_direction: looking slightly upwards at the viewer
characters.composition: Character positioned to the left, camera slightly angled

text: Have you guessed the riddle yet?

characters.composition: Main character positioned slightly to the right, camera slightly low angle

characters.composition: March Hare positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

text: I sighed wearily.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "I think you might do something better with the time," I said, "than waste it in asking riddles that have no answers."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "If you knew Time as well as I do," said the Hatter, "you wouldn’t talk about wasting _it_. It’s _him_."

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "I don’t know what you mean," I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "Of course you don’t!"

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly overhead

text: the Hatter said, tossing his head contemptuously.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly low angle

text: "I dare say you never even spoke to Time!"

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly low angle

text: "Perhaps not," I cautiously replied: "but I know I have to beat time when I learn music."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "Ah! that accounts for it," said the Hatter.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly low angle

text: "He won’t stand beating. Now, if you only kept on good terms with him, he’d do almost anything you liked with the clock. For instance, suppose it were nine o’clock in the morning, just time to begin lessons: you’d only have to whisper a hint to Time, and round goes the clock in a twinkling! Half-past one, time for dinner!"

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter centered, camera slightly low angle

text: "I only wish it was,"

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: the March Hare said to itself in a whisper.

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: March Hare positioned on the left side of the frame, camera at eye level

text: "That would be grand, certainly," I said thoughtfully: "but then—I shouldn’t be hungry for it, you know."

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: "Not at first, perhaps," said the Hatter: "but you could keep it to half-past one as long as you liked."

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned on the right side of the frame, camera at eye level

text: "Is that the way _you_ manage?" I asked.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The Hatter shook his head mournfully.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned on the right side of the frame, camera at eye level

text: "Not I!" he replied.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "We quarrelled last March—just before _he_ went mad, you know—"

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: (pointing with his tea spoon at the March Hare,)

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "—it was at the great concert given by the Queen of Hearts, and I had to sing 'Twinkle, twinkle, little bat! How I wonder what you’re at!' You know the song, perhaps?"

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "I’ve heard something like it," I said.

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: "It goes on, you know," the Hatter continued,

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Dormouse positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: and went on so long that they had to pinch it to make it stop.

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Dormouse positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Queen
characters.composition: Queen positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: I exclaimed, “How dreadfully savage!”

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter

text: A bright idea came into my head.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: The Hatter
characters.composition: The Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

text: “Then you keep moving round, I suppose?” I said.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: The Hatter
characters.composition: The Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: The March Hare

text: “I vote the young lady tells us a story.”

characters.name: The March Hare
characters.composition: The March Hare positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.composition: Dormouse positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: March Hare
characters.composition: March Hare positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Dormouse

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

characters.name: I

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the left, camera at eye level

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Character positioned to the right, camera frontal

characters.name: Narrator
characters.composition: Narrator positioned on the left, camera slightly angled

text: “What did they draw?” I asked, quite forgetting my promise.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Dormouse positioned on the right, camera slightly angled

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned on the left, camera slightly angled

text: He moved on as he spoke, and the Dormouse followed him: the March Hare moved into the Dormouse’s place, and I rather unwillingly took the place of the March Hare.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: The Hatter was the only one who got any advantage from the change: and I was a good deal worse off than before, as the March Hare had just upset the milk-jug into his plate.

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned on the left side, camera slightly low angle

text: I did not wish to offend the Dormouse again, so I began very cautiously: “But I don’t understand. Where did they draw the treacle from?”

characters.name: Hatter

characters.name: Hatter
characters.composition: Hatter positioned on the left side, camera slightly low angle

text: “But they were _in_ the well,” I said to the Dormouse, not choosing to notice this last remark.

characters.composition: Dormouse positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the right, camera slightly low angle

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.composition: Dormouse positioned to the left, camera slightly low angle

characters.name: Dormouse

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character positioned to the right, camera frontal

characters.name: Five

characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.composition: Character positioned centrally, camera slightly overhead

characters.name: Five

characters.name: Five
characters.composition: Character positioned slightly to the right, camera at eye level

characters.name: Two

text: The chief difficulty I found at first was in managing my flamingo: I succeeded in getting its body tucked away, comfortably enough, under my arm, with its legs hanging down, but generally, just as I had got its neck nicely straightened out, and was going to give the hedgehog a blow with its head, it would twist itself round and look up in my face, with such a puzzled expression that I could not help bursting out laughing:

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character centered, camera slightly overhead

text: and when I had got its head down, and was going to begin again, it was very provoking to find that the hedgehog had unrolled itself, and was in the act of crawling away: besides all this, there was generally a ridge or furrow in the way wherever I wanted to send the hedgehog to, and, as the doubled-up soldiers were always getting up and walking off to other parts of the ground, I soon came to the conclusion that it was a very difficult game indeed.

characters.name: I
characters.composition: Main character off-center, camera at eye level

text: The players all played at once without waiting for turns, quarrelling all the while, and fighting for the hedgehogs;

characters.name: I

text: I began to feel very uneasy: to be sure, I had not as yet had any dispute with the Queen, but I knew that it might happen any minute, “and then,” I thought, “what would become of me? They’re dreadfully fond of beheading people here; the great wonder is, that there’s any one left alive!”

characters.name: Alice
characters.composition: Alice positioned slightly off-center, camera at eye level

text: I was looking about for some way of escape, and wondering whether I could get away without being seen, when I noticed a curious appearance in the air: it puzzled me very much at first, but, after watching it a minute or two, I made it out to be a grin, and I said to myself “It’s the Cheshire Cat: now I shall have somebody to talk to.”

characters.name: Alice

text: “Why,” he said, “you first form into a line along the sea-shore—”

characters.name: Gryphon
characters.composition: Gryphon centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Two lines!” cried the Mock Turtle.

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.composition: Mock Turtle centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Seals, turtles, salmon, and so on;”

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.composition: Mock Turtle centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “That generally takes some time,” interrupted the Gryphon.

characters.name: Gryphon
characters.composition: Gryphon positioned on the left, camera slightly low angle

text: The Mock Turtle, undeterred, continued, “—you advance twice—”

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.composition: Mock Turtle centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “Each with a lobster as a partner!” shouted the Gryphon.

characters.name: Gryphon
characters.composition: Gryphon positioned on the right, camera slightly high angle

text: “Of course,” the Mock Turtle said: “advance twice, set to partners—”

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.composition: Mock Turtle centered, camera slightly overhead

text: “—change lobsters, and retire in same order,” continued the Gryphon.

characters.name: Gryphon
characters.composition: Gryphon positioned on the left, camera slightly low angle
